Name: CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations Benchmark v5.0.0
Description: The CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations Benchmark provides prescriptive guidance for configuring security options for a subset of Amazon Web Services.

Attributes.Description: Ensure contact email and telephone details for AWS accounts are current and map to more than one individual in your organization.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: If an AWS account is observed to be behaving in a prohibited or suspicious manner, AWS will attempt to contact the account owner by email and phone using the contact details listed.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: This activity can only be performed via the AWS Console. Navigate to Account Settings and update contact information.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: This activity can only be performed via the AWS Console. Navigate to Account Settings and verify contact information is current.

Requirements.Description: Ensure no 'root' user account access key exists

Attributes.Description: The 'root' user account is the most privileged user in an AWS account. AWS Access Keys provide programmatic access to a given AWS account.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Deleting access keys associated with the 'root' user account limits vectors by which the account can be compromised.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Navigate to IAM console, select root user, Security credentials tab, and delete any access keys.
Attributes.AdditionalInformation: IAM User account root for us-gov cloud regions is not enabled by default.

Requirements.Description: Ensure credentials unused for 45 days or more are disabled

Attributes.Description: AWS IAM users can access AWS resources using different types of credentials. It is recommended that all credentials unused for 45 days or more be deactivated or removed.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Disabling or removing unnecessary credentials reduces the window of opportunity for compromised accounts.
Attributes.ImpactStatement: Users with deactivated credentials will lose access until re-enabled.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Use IAM console or CLI to deactivate unused access keys and remove unused passwords.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Generate credential report and review password_last_used and access_key_last_used fields.
